api_output.description: xml, json, or serialize (default is XML)

email.description: Email of the new contact. Example: 'test@example.com'

field.description: 'value' (You can also use the personalization tag to specify which field you want updated)

first_name.description: First name of the contact. Example: 'FirstName'

form.description: Optional subscription Form ID, to inherit those redirection settings. Example: 1001. This will allow you to mimic adding the contact through a subscription form, where you can take advantage of the redirection settings.

instantresponders.description: Use only if status = 1. Whether or not to set "send instant responders." Examples: 1 = yes, 0 = no.

ip4.description: IP address of the contact. Example: '127.0.0.1' If not supplied, it will default to '127.0.0.1'

last_name.description: Last name of the contact. Example: 'LastName'

lastmessage.description: Whether or not to set "send the last broadcast campaign." Examples: 1 = yes, 0 = no.

noresponders.description: Whether or not to set "do not send any future responders." Examples: 1 = yes, 0 = no.

orgname.description: Organization name (if doesn't exist, this will create a new organization) - MUST HAVE CRM FEATURE FOR THIS.

p.description: Assign to lists. List ID goes in brackets, as well as the value.

phone.description: Phone number of the contact. Example: '+1 312 201 0300'

sdate.description: Subscribe date for particular list - leave out to use current date/time. Example: '2009-12-07 06:00:00'

status.description: The status for each list the contact is added to. Examples: 1 = active, 2 = unsubscribed

tags.description: Tags for this contact (comma-separated). Example: "tag1, tag2, etc"
